title: Are there any places for my children to read kids’ books? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are actually a lot of places where you can give a kid’s books for your child to read. In my case, there are some local library near me which are free to enter and read there. Other than that, I usually go online when I don’t have the time to take my child’s there. I’m using this application to read a book online through my phone, or tab for my child’s. The book is in an eBook format and if you don’t know, eBook[1] is an electronic book, also known as an e-book or eBook, is a book publication made available in digital form, consisting of text, images, or both, readable on the flat-panel display of computers or other electronic devices. There are two reading there that became my child’s favorite. The first one is called “Adventure of Huckleberry Finn”, and the second one is called “Just So Stories”. If you’re wondering where to go and what to read, then you can give these books a try. Footnotes[1] http://E-book - Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-book)

Nature is our greatest teacher as she has got so many things in store for us and has her ways to teach people and make them aware of its importance. You can take to your children out in the garden and teach or read to them as well as play with them. It is a really fun and interesting way of teaching, in that kind of environment. You can visit the nearby libraries too as that will encourage reading and exploration in children and also helps to participate in the community.  I hope you will find many collections of children’s books at MyPustak, which is an online website for used books free of cost or at a cheap price (pay the shipping and handling charges). Best wishes.
Most local libraries have a decent to excellent selection of children's books. If you or your children have a library card, your kids can check out their selections and take them home with them!
